creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
markings:
each page showing the scene of special products being made;
Fishing River Shrimps(Kawa-ebi)
Fishing River Trout in August(Hachi-gatsu sabi-ayu)
Fishing Eels at Seta(Seta no unagi)
Fishing Mullet(Efuna hiki-ami)
Gathering Corbicula(Shijimi-kai)
Gathering Shellfish at Amagasaki in Sesshu_ Province(Sesshu_ Amagasaki tsuno-gai)
Women Divers and Fishermen(Ama)
Gathering Eggs(or Baby Fish) of Saury Pikes(Kamasu-ko)
Netting Sardins(Iwashi-ami)
Looking for Whales(Kujira no to_mi)
Whaling(Kujira ki wo fuki zu)
Netting Whale(Kujira oki-ami)
Whale Hunting(Kujira tsuki-bune)
Dragging Whale(Kujira hiki yose zu)

On the last page;
Artist Sho_suiken Hasegawa Mitsunobu
designed Early Summer of Ho-reki 4 
printed Kansei 9(1797)
edited by Hirase Tessen
distributed by Harimaya K_be_, KaKagamiya Cho_be_, Kagamiya Uhe_
medium: Woodblock printed book; ink on paper
title: Famous Products from Mountain and Sea vol. 5
